quizDescription: Test your knowledge of the history of the Olympic Games with this sports quiz.

questions.question: In which year were the first modern Olympic Games held?
questions.explanation: The first modern Olympic Games were held in Athens, Greece, in 1896.

questions.question: Which city hosted the 1980 Summer Olympics, which were boycotted by several countries?
questions.explanation: The 1980 Summer Olympics were hosted by Moscow, but they saw a boycott by several countries in protest.

questions.question: Who is the legendary sprinter known as 'The Fastest Man on Earth'?
questions.explanation: Usain Bolt from Jamaica is known as 'The Fastest Man on Earth' for his remarkable sprinting achievements.

questions.question: Which country has won the most medals in the history of the Winter Olympics?
questions.explanation: Norway is the country with the most medals in the history of the Winter Olympics.

questions.question: Which sport is not part of the Summer Olympics?
questions.explanation: Figure skating is a sport in the Winter Olympics, not the Summer Olympics.
